snippet: Opposition leaders refused to say whether they would participate in the vote, reflecting the dysfunction that has paralyzed Thai politics for months.
abstract: Thailand’s election commission says it will try to hold a vote, but opposition leaders refused to say whether they will participate, underlining the country’s political paralysis.
lead_paragraph: Opposition leaders refused to say whether they would participate in the vote, reflecting the dysfunction that has paralyzed Thai politics for months.

headline.main: Thailand Says It Will Try to Hold an Election in July
headline.print_headline: Thailand: July Election Is Proposed, but Opposition May Not Participate
